intro: Randia blepharophylla, commonly known as the veiny randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive veining pattern, which gives it its common name. Randia blepharophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
